sentences.english: My daughter Eliot performed a supervisory role during the construction
sentences.chinese: 我女儿Eliot在建造过程中起监工的作用。

sentences.english: But even at work he was the task-master in absentia .
sentences.chinese: 即便外出，他也是个缺席监工。

sentences.english: The overlooker has to overlook a large number of employees.
The supervisor of the workers dismissed the salesman's claims.
sentences.chinese: 监工回绝了销售员的要求。

sentences.english: Recognize that business is a cruel taskmaster.
sentences.chinese: 认识到业务是个残酷的监工。

sentences.english: But even at work he was the task-master in absentia.
sentences.chinese: 即使外出，他也是个缺席监工。

sentences.english: One of the supervisors, age 14, is accused of beating workers with whips.
sentences.chinese: 其中一位被指控用鞭子抽打工人的监工，年仅14岁。

sentences.english: He is an experienced foreman and is in charge of three work teams.
sentences.chinese: 他是个经验老道的监工，管理三个工队。

sentences.english: I whispered to my brother as the slavedriver passed by.
sentences.chinese: 我悄声告诉大哥，可不巧，这时候监工经过。

sentences.english: A welding overseer picks up$ 400a week.
sentences.chinese: 电焊工监工每周挣400英镑。

definition: bitter work/hard toil/(loanword) coolie, unskilled Chinese laborer in colonial times
to help with farm work/casual laborer
erhua variant of 幹活|干活[gan4 huo2]
